intro: Pseudolmedia murure, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid and rocky regions. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, which can cause skin irritation. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous or desert environments. Pseudolmedia murure is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and low moisture conditions.
